created_at: one last post from me. Last night
column3: just to check my sanity in this Alice-in-Wonderland market
column4: I had another look at ZIM's financial reports over the years. In particular
column5: I was interested to see whether the changes in book value (taking into account equity lost to dividends) were comparable to declared earnings (should be
column6: if earnings reflect an economic reality free of creative accounting). Yes
column8: although the company was in trouble before 2018 (the pre-Glickman era).

body: What interested me was the way in which the yearly change in book value turned around from a negative value in 2018
column8: and has already reached +4167 in 2022 (without Q4 earnings). To put in simple terms
column9: a change in book value of 500M means a dividend of about $2 pa. What will happen in 2023? I have no idea.

created_at: as the Dow was most recently trading 296 points higher (0.9%). Walt Disney's shares have gained $4.05
column4: while those of Boeing are up $6.53 (3.1%)
